section.title: Both, neither and either
section.sectiontitle: Use both, neither or either to talk about two things or people. Use either to say "one or the other". Use neither to say "not this one and not that one." Use neither and either with singular nouns.
section.text1a: He's from either Namibia or Zimbabwe. I don't know which.
section.text2a: I have two sisters. Neither of them is married.
section.sectiontitle2: Use both to talk about "one and the other". Use both with plural nouns.
section.text4a: I like both of these jackets.

section.title: Both, neither and either
section.sectiontitle: Both/neither/either can be followed by of + pronoun/the/them/those, etc.
section.text1a: Neither of them is going to pass their exam.
section.text2a: Both of those trees are beautiful.
